title: Arewa Data Science Fellowship
text:
ArewaDS Application is Open :::
The Arewa Data Science Fellowship application is open. The Arewa Data Science fellowship (ADSF) provides an opportunity to learn from data scientists and machine learning experts. The fellowship is a 16-week-long free training that provides a hands-on approach to data science, machine learning and deep learning.
The skills and knowledge acquired during the fellowship will help participants pursue careers in data science, machine learning and research. Our goal is to inspire the next generation of researchers in the North and provide them with the tools they need to be successful. The ADSF fellowship provides support with a monthly stipend during the program.
Applications will be judged based on the strength of the motivation of the applicant, academic record, and scholarly potential.
Application is now closed !

title: Arewa Data Science Team Wins Competition
text:
ArewaDS-LMBF, a team from the Arewa Data Science Fellowship, achieved an impressive feat on May 13th, 2023, by securing second place in the Cohere AI hackathon. Organized by Cohere and AI Saturdays Lagos, the hackathon centered around the theme ‚ÄúEmpower your creativity with Cohere‚Äôs Multilingual Embeddings‚Äù and was hosted on devpost. The event spanned from May 1st to May 7th, 2023, with participants gathering at multiple locations across the continent, including the enthusiastic Arewa Data Science Academy community.
The teams representing ArewaDS showcased their expertise in machine learning, particularly in large language models, as they presented their innovative projects utilizing the Cohere multilingual embeddings API. Among the submissions, ArewaDS-LMBF proposed an exceptional solution that utilised the multilingual embeddings API to align Hausa sentences with their potential translations in English. This approach aimed to contribute to the creation of accurate parallel datasets for machine translation. Their outstanding submission propelled them to the finals, securing them a well-deserved second place in the overall rankings.
Lukman, the team lead of ArewaDS-LMBF, expressed his overwhelming delight at this historic achievement. He remarked, ‚ÄúStarting from scratch in machine learning and winning an AI hackathon within a few months of joining the fellowship is truly incredible. The unwavering support of the mentors in Arewa Data Science Academy played a pivotal role in this accomplishment. They ensured equal opportunities for all fellows and guided us to the right resources. I am immensely grateful for this invaluable experience.‚Äù
As a reward for their outstanding performance, the team was granted a prize of 800 US Dollars, along with 2000 Cohere API credits, to be shared among the five team members. Looking ahead, the team revealed their plans to further enhance their solution while harnessing the cohere platform to deepen their understanding of Natural Language Processing and Large Language Models. Their commitment to continuous improvement and exploration exemplifies their dedication to excellence.
This accomplishment offers a mere glimpse into the transformative impact that the Arewa Data Science Fellowship has had on the lives of its young fellows within a short span of time. The Arewa Data Science Fellowship stands as an intensive program designed to nurture the next generation of research-oriented data scientists. Through its mentorship, monthly stipends, and provision of data, the fellowship equips aspiring data scientists with the necessary tools to thrive in their field. For more information about the fellowship, please visit our website.

title: Arewa Data Science Academy Fellowship: A Transformative Journey to Success in Data Science
text:
The Arewa Data Science Academy fellowship has been an exceptional journey that has profoundly shaped my life this year. In just six months, I have acquired a wealth of knowledge, leaving an indelible mark on my personal and professional growth.
The fellowship‚Äôs comprehensive curriculum not only covered programming and data science skills but also delved into vital areas like version control using Git. Engaging and interactive workshops provided me with hands-on experiences that deepened my understanding of this critical aspect of modern software development. Additionally, I honed my expertise in bash scripting and command-line usage, enhancing my technical proficiency.
An extraordinary aspect of the fellowship was its focus on sharing our learning experiences through blogging. With training in using Quarto, I mastered the art of effective scientific writing, perfecting my ability to communicate complex ideas concisely. Blogging not only allowed me to reflect on my progress but also reinforced my understanding of the concepts I was learning, solidifying my grasp on data science principles.
Throughout this transformative journey, our mentors played an indispensable role. Their immense talent and dedication created a supportive and encouraging environment for us to thrive. Regular updates and organization through platforms like Notion, slack and telegram ensured we never missed any valuable insights, keeping us on track and motivated.
Beyond technical skills, the fellowship also emphasized essential aspects of professional development, including crafting an impressive CV. With practical exercises using LaTeX, we learned to create captivating CVs that effectively showcased our capabilities. The mentors‚Äô commitment to providing personalized feedback and constructive criticism proved invaluable in refining our CVs to perfection, preparing us for future career opportunities.
The Arewa Data Science Academy has been an absolute blessing, propelling me beyond the boundaries of my imagination. As a part of this prestigious fellowship, I have gained newfound confidence and a fervor for continuous learning. My technical repertoire has expanded, and I have developed a deeper sense of self-awareness and determination to succeed in the data science field.
Reflecting on my journey as a fellow, I am amazed by how much I have achieved in such a short time. The skills and knowledge I have acquired will undoubtedly pave the way for a bright future in data science, and I am eager to explore the limitless possibilities that lie ahead. The academy has laid a strong foundation for my ongoing pursuit of excellence, inspiring me to keep pushing my boundaries and seeking new challenges.
In conclusion, joining the Arewa Data Science Academy fellowship has been a pivotal moment in my life. It has equipped me with a diverse set of skills, provided a supportive network, and instilled an unwavering passion for continuous growth. I am profoundly grateful for this transformative experience and eagerly anticipate the boundless opportunities that await me on this remarkable path of learning and discovery.

section: A Special Invitation to Aspiring Data Scientists, with a Focus on Women
text:
A Special Invitation to Aspiring Data Scientists, with a Focus on Women
At Arewa Data Science Academy, we firmly believe in the inclusivity and diversity of the data science field. This is why we extend a warm invitation to all aspiring data scientists who wish to delve into this dynamic area of study. We are particularly enthusiastic about encouraging women in our community to join us in this endeavor. Ladies, your unique perspectives and contributions are invaluable in the field of data science, and we are excited to support you on this journey. Everyone interested in discovering the potential of data science, regardless of your background, is welcome. Click here to apply and take your first step towards a fulfilling career in data science.

title: Successful Applicants for the 3rd Cohort of the Python Fellowship
text:
Exciting News: Successful Applicants for the 3rd Cohort of the Python Fellowship!
We are thrilled to announce that the successful applicants for the 3rd cohort of the Arewa Data Science Academy Python Fellowship have been selected! We want to congratulate all the new fellows who have demonstrated their dedication, skills, and passion for data science and programming. This fellowship will empower you to further your knowledge, build impactful projects, and become part of a vibrant community of learners and mentors.
Selected applicants have been notified via email. We encourage all successful fellows to check their inboxes for important details regarding the next steps, including instructions on how to join the cohort and prepare for the exciting journey ahead.
We received an overwhelming number of applications, and we‚Äôre truly impressed by the high quality of submissions. To those who were not selected this time, we want to say: don‚Äôt be discouraged. There are many opportunities to grow, learn, and participate in future programs. Your enthusiasm is what drives the community forward, and we hope to see you apply again in the future.
For more updates, resources, and community events, stay tuned to our website and social media channels. We are eager to watch this new cohort grow, collaborate, and make a mark in the field of data science.
Congratulations once again to the new fellows! Let the journey begin!

title: ArewaDS FellowShip
text:
Get in Touch
Thank you for visiting the Arewa Data Science Academy website. We are dedicated to providing accessible and quality data science education to marginalized students and we value your feedback and input.
Our team is here to assist you with any questions or inquiries you may have. Whether you are interested in learning more about our programs, exploring potential collaboration opportunities, or just want to know more about what we do, please do not hesitate to reach out.
For general inquiries, you can contact us via email at arewadatascience@gmail.com. We will make every effort to respond to your inquiry in a timely manner, typically within 24 hours during business days.
We also have a Telegram channel for students and learners where you can connect with us, collaborate, ask questions and connect with like-minded people, you can join by visiting this link
Here at Arewa Data Science Academy, we believe that data science education should be accessible to all and we strive to empower marginalized students to achieve their full potential through our programs. We are excited to hear from you and to work together towards a more equitable future in data science.
Thank you for your interest in Arewa Data Science Academy. We value your feedback and would love to hear from you. If you are interested to be a mentor, please, reach out.
Email: arewadatascience[at]gmail.com.
Telegram Channel: click to join.

title: Bashir Mohammed
text:
Biography
Bashir is an experienced AI/ML researcher and a staff Computational Research Engineer at Berkeley Lab. He is part of Berkeley Lab‚Äôs Cybersecurity R&D for Science and Energy in the Integrated Data Frameworks(IDF) group under the Scientific Data Division.
His research revolves around AI/ML for networking, systems control, data provenance, and scientific data management in HPC and distributed systems.
In the past, he was a postdoc on the Deep Learning and Artificial Intelligence High-Performance Networks(DAPHNE) project at Berkeley Lab. His work focused on developing AI and Machine Learning algorithms to optimally control distributed network resources, improve high-speed big data transfers and control high-speed networks that will minimize network downtime and avoid network traffic congestion for critical exascale scientific workflows.
He is a Berkeley Lab research SLAM 2019 award winner. In 2019 he was among six postdoctoral fellows from US National Labs invited to Washington DC, to speak to the Capitol Hill audience about their research. He is a passionate science communicator.

title: Mustapha Abdullahi
text:
Biography
Mustapha is a Master‚Äôs in Artificial Intelligence student at the Queen Mary University of London. He is a recipient of the Google DeepMind Scholarship and the joint QuantumBlack (a McKinsey Company) and Office of AI scholarship. He is a student intern at the Large Scale and Data Systems (LSDS), Imperial College London.
Before his Master‚Äôs, Mustapha obtained a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Engineering from Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria. His interests span Machine Learning, Reinforcement Learning, and Robotics.

title: Abubakar Bala
text:
Biography
Just finished a PhD on using AI to detect faults in the engines of aircrafts.
Now I am focused on building end-end machine learning applications (MLOps)
I also do public speaking and write thought-provoking stories.

title: Fauziya Ado Yakasai
text:
Biography
Dr.Yakasai is an experienced researcher and data science professional with over 7 years of combined experience in data science, statistics, mathematics, and research in academia and corporate America. Expert in applied mathematics, statistics, business analytics, and data science with a rich blend of teaching and quantitative research experience.
Hardworking mathematicians, statisticians, and business/data analysts with expertise in statistical and data modeling, probability, and numerical integration. Proficient in data mining techniques, including data entry, compilation, sampling, cleaning, transformation, QA/QC, data visualization, etc. Strong passion and commitment in artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and deep learning (DL)
Fauziya holds a Bachelor of Science (BS) in Mathematics from Bayero University, Kano, Nigeria; a Master of Science (MS) in Pure and Applied Mathematics from the African University of Science and Technology, Abuja, Nigeria; a Master of Science (MS) in Probability and Statistics from Auburn University, Auburn, Alabama; and a PhD in Mathematics from Auburn University, Auburn, Alabama. She has a Graduate Certification in Business Analytics from Auburn University in Auburn, Alabama. She is currently a postdoctoral fellow in Data Analysis of R&D partnerships at York University, Canada, and a Data Science consultant at LOCOMeX inc USA.

title: Ibrahim S. Ahmad
text:
Biography
I am currently a lecturer with the Department of Information Technology, Bayero University Kano. I completed my Ph.D at Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Malaysia in 2020.
My research interests lie in the areas of Data Science which includes areas of Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning.
I am a co-founder of the HausaNLP (www.hausanlp.org) research group, where we focus on research related to NLP in African (low resource) languages. We are beneficiaries of over 10 research grants across diverse areas of NLP in low resource languages.
As a lecturer with Bayero University Kano, my responsibilities include teaching and supervising both undergraduate and postgraduate students. Currently, I teach CSC8303 Artificial Intelligence for MSc Computer Science program and ICT8302 Enterprise Database Management for Master of Information and Communication Technology.

title: Lukman Aliyu Jibril
text:
Biography
Lukman is a dedicated professional thriving in the dynamic landscape of data science and AI. Currently contributing his expertise to Zipline, Nigeria‚Äôs fulfillment operations, Lukman finds genuine fulfillment in harnessing the power of data. With a solid foundation as a trained pharmacist from Ahmadu Bello University, he has seamlessly transitioned into the world of data science, making remarkable strides in his journey.
Lukman‚Äôs passion for AI is evident in his enthusiastic pursuit of knowledge and skills. Having completed his fellowship as a distinguished member of the inaugural cohort, he has swiftly ascended to a mentorship role, guiding and inspiring aspiring data enthusiasts. Lukman‚Äôs thirst for growth is unquenchable, as he continues to engage in cutting-edge research and pursue further educational opportunities.
His unique background and rapid progression make Lukman a valuable asset to any mentee seeking to navigate the exciting realms of data science and AI.

title: Shamsuddeen H. Muhammad
text:
Biography
Shamsuddeen is a Founder of Arewa Data Science Academy (ADSA) and Co-founder of HausaNLP. He is a faculty member at the Faculty of Computer Science at Bayero University in Kano, Nigeria.
Currently, shamsuddeen is a PhD candidate at the University of Porto in Portugal. His research interests focus on Natural Language Processing for Low-resource languages, Sentiment Analysis, and Deep Learning. He received his Master‚Äôs degree from the University of Manchester in the UK and a Bachelor‚Äôs degree from Bayero University in Kano, Nigeria.

title: Musa Muhammed Kabila
text:
Biography
Kabila is an enthusiastic data analyst experienced with Machine learning (ML), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data Mining, and Natural Language Processing (NLP).
He received his Bachelor of Science degrees from Bayero University, Kano, Master of Engineering from Central South University, China and Master of Education from University of the People, USA.
Kabila‚Äôs research interests lie in the areas of Data Science with keen interest in areas of Natural Language Processing, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Artificial Intelligence.

title: Idris Abdulmumin
text:
Biography
Idris Abdulmumin is a lecturer at the Department of Computer Science, Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria. He is currently a postdoctoral fellow at the Data Science for Social Impact Research Group at the University of Pretoria, South Africa, under the supervision of Professor Vukosi Marivate. He obtained his PhD from Bayero University, Kano in 2023, under the supervision of Professor Bashir Shehu Galadanci, having conducted doctoral research on machine translation for low-resource languages. He has led impactful projects, including MasaKhane‚Äôs submission to WMT22 and managing the Lacuna 2022 grant for ‚ÄúAfriHate,‚Äù a hate speech dataset for African languages. With roles in organising AfriSenti-SemEval 2023 and SemRel-SemEval 2024, curating datasets like Hausa Visual Genome, Hausa Visual Question Answering, LAFAND-MT and MasaKhaNER 2.0, and leading initiatives like HauWE, Idris is dedicated to advancing NLP for African languages. His contributions extend to LREC publications and driving language technology‚Äôs progress within African contexts. His LinkedIn profile can be accessed via https://www.linkedin.com/in/abumafrim/

import os

files = os.listdir()

# rename all files in the directory
for file in files:
  if file.endswith('.qmd'):
    new_name = '_'.join(file.split('_')[:-1]) + '.qmd'
    print(f'{file} -> {new_name}')
    os.rename(file, new_name)


import shutil
import pandas as pd
from pathlib import Path

dl = pd.read_csv('/Users/abumafrim/Downloads/dl-c2.csv')
ml = pd.read_csv('/Users/abumafrim/Downloads/ml-c3.csv')

dl = dl.dropna(subset=['Full Name'])
ml = ml.dropna(subset=['Name '])

dl_out_dir = Path('/Users/abumafrim/Documents/GitHub/arewadatascience.github.io/people/fellows/dl-2')
ml_out_dir = Path('/Users/abumafrim/Documents/GitHub/arewadatascience.github.io/people/fellows/ml-3')


template = """---
title: "<<fname>> <<lname>>"
sortby: "<<lname>>, <<fname>>"
subtitle: "<<admission_number>>"
state: "<<state>>"
completed: "‚ùå"
toc: false
about:
  id: person-profile
  template: jolla
format: html
engine: knitr
---

```{css, echo = FALSE}
.justify {
  text-align: justify !important
}
```

```{=html}
    <li class="breadcrumb-item active">Alumni</li>
    <li class="breadcrumb-item active" aria-current="page">{{< meta title >}}</li>

</nav> 
```

:::{#person-profile}

::: {.justify}

## Achievement
Admitted.
:::"""


if dl_out_dir.exists():
  shutil.rmtree(dl_out_dir)
if ml_out_dir.exists():
  shutil.rmtree(ml_out_dir)

dl_out_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
ml_out_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

for idx, full_name in enumerate(dl['Full Name']):
  names = full_name.strip().split()
  if not names:
    continue
  lname = names[-1]
  fname = ' '.join(names[:-1])
  f_name = '_'.join(names).lower()

  admission_number = 'N/A'
  state = 'N/A'

  template_filled = template.replace('<<fname>>', fname) \
                            .replace('<<lname>>', lname) \
                            .replace('<<admission_number>>', admission_number) \
                            .replace('<<state>>', state)

  out_file = dl_out_dir / f'{idx:03d}_{f_name}.qmd'
  print(f'Writing {out_file}')
  with open(out_file, 'w') as f:
    f.write(template_filled)

for idx, row in ml.iterrows():
  try:
    names = row['Name '].strip().split()
    if not names:
      print(f"Skipping empty name in row {idx}")
      continue
    lname = names[-1]
    fname = ' '.join(names[:-1])
    f_name = '_'.join(names).lower()
    
  except Exception as e:
    print(f"Skipping row {idx} due to error: {e}")
    continue

  admission_number = row.get('Fellowship Id', 'N/A')
  state = 'N/A'

  template_filled = template.replace('<<fname>>', fname) \
                            .replace('<<lname>>', lname) \
                            .replace('<<admission_number>>', admission_number) \
                            .replace('<<state>>', state)

  out_file = ml_out_dir / f'{idx:03d}_{f_name}.qmd'
  print(f'Writing {out_file}')
  with open(out_file, 'w') as f:
    f.write(template_filled)

title: Arewa Data Science Fellowship
text:
Arewa Data Science Fellowship
Welcome to Arewa Data Science Academy! We are a community of educators, learners and data science enthusiasts with a passion for empowering marginalized students to reach their full potential.
Our mission is to provide students with the skills and knowledge they need to succeed in the rapidly evolving field of data science. We believe that everyone should have access to the tools and resources they need to pursue their dreams, regardless of their background or circumstances.
To achieve this mission, we offer a wide range of programs and services to students from all over Nigeria. Our student mentoring programs provide personalized support and guidance to help students succeed in their studies. We also offer seminars and workshops on data science, machine learning and related fields to university students, to help them stay current with the latest advancements in the field.
One of the core focus of our academy is free training to affected marginalized students, we hold weekend training sessions and this year we are thrilled to announce that these training will be more structured and streamlined than ever before, thanks to the sponsorship of Google Research, TensorFlow and HausaNLP and Bayero University Kano. We are particularly focusing on underrepresented groups such as Women and Students from Arewa and communities affected by insecurity as part of our efforts to bridge the gap and bring equal opportunities to all.
We invite you to join our community and be a part of our mission to empower marginalized students and build a more equitable future. Thank you for considering Arewa Data Science Academy!

title: Application is Now Open for Arewa Data Science Fellowships
text:
Application is Now Open for Arewa Data Science Fellowships
Are you passionate about the power of data and its potential to drive positive change in society? Are you eager to enhance your data science skills and make a significant impact in your community? If so, we invite you to apply for the Arewa Data Science Fellowships!
We are excited to announce the opening of applications for our comprehensive fellowship programs, designed to cater to various levels of expertise in data science. Whether you are a beginner or an advanced learner, we have a fellowship that suits your needs.

Program Highlights:

Arewa Data Science Python Programming Fellowship (Introductory)

Curriculum: Data science, Python, data visualization, and more.
Deadline: 16th September 2024, 11:59 pm.
Apply Now: click here

Arewa Data Science R Programming Fellowship (Introductory)

Curriculum: R programming, data analysis, machine learning, data visualization, and more.
Deadline: 20th September 2024, 11:59 pm.
Apply Now: click here

Deep Learning with PyTorch Fellowship (Intermediate)

Curriculum: Deep learning, PyTorch, machine learning, and more.
Deadline: 20th September 2024, 11:59 pm.
Apply Now: click here

Arewa Data Science NLP Fellowship (Advanced)

Curriculum: NLP, deep learning, PyTorch, Large Language Models, Generative AI, and more.
Deadline: 20th September 2024, 11:59 pm.
Apply Now: click here




Hands-on Projects and Networking
All our fellowships include hands-on projects that allow participants to work on real-world data challenges, ensuring practical experience and a robust portfolio. Additionally, you will be part of a collaborative learning environment where you can network with like-minded individuals, share insights, and build connections that can support your career growth.


Important Dates:

Application Period Opens: Now
Application Deadlines:

Python Programming Fellowship: 16th September 2024, 11:59 pm.
R Programming Fellowship: 20th September 2024, 11:59 pm.
Deep Learning with PyTorch Fellowship: 20th September 2024, 11:59 pm.
NLP Fellowship: 20th September 2024, 11:59 pm.


For any inquiries or further information, please reach out to our team at arewadatascience@gmail.com.
Join us in shaping the future through data science! We look forward to receiving your applications and welcoming you to the Arewa Data Science Fellowships.

title: Arewa Data Science Academy Announces Successful Applicants
section: Second Cohort of Machine Learning Fellowship
text:
Second Cohort of Machine Learning Fellowship
We are thrilled to announce that 81 dedicated learners have been chosen for the second cohort of the Arewa Data Science Fellowship - a prestigious four-month program focusing on machine learning. Throughout the fellowship, fellows are immersed in an intensive data science curriculum anchored on real-world projects and guided mentorship. The objective extends beyond mere knowledge acquisition, as they are also educated about the nuances of research and broader learning.

Gender: Out of the total, 67 fellows are male, and 14 are female.
Education: The majority are Bachelor‚Äôs degree holders, with some pursuing or holding Master‚Äôs or PhD degrees.
Geographic Spread: Fellows hail from various states across our nation, and some are even currently based abroad.
Alma Mater Spotlight: The top three universities from which our fellows have graduated or currently studying in are Bayero University Kano (BUK), Ahmadu Bello University (ABU) in Zaria, and Yusuf Maitama Sule University in Kano.
Tech Skills: Approximately 45% of the fellows have experience with the Python programming language, while a segment of them are newcomers to programming. We believe that this fellowship will serve as a stepping stone for these bright minds, enabling them to evolve into pioneers and researchers in the data science domain.

title: Arewa Data Science Academy Announces Successful Applicants
text:
Deep Learning with PyTorch Fellowship
We are equally excited to introduce 19 adept individuals who have been enrolled in the inaugural cohort of the Deep Learning with PyTorch Fellowship under the Arewa Data Science Academy. Interestingly, many of them are alumni from our first data science fellowship cohort, showcasing the continuous learning spirit.
This growth and eagerness to learn underscore the dynamic evolution of the Arewa Data Science community. A heartfelt congratulations to all the selected fellows on this remarkable achievement! Your journey ahead promises to be enlightening and transformative.

title: Arewa Data Science Application is Open
text:
Application is now Open
Are you passionate about the power of data and its potential to drive positive change in society? Are you eager to enhance your data science skills and make a significant impact in your community? If so, we invite you to apply for the Arewa DataScience Program!
Program Highlights:

Comprehensive Curriculum: The program offers a well-structured curriculum that covers essential data science concepts, including data analysis, machine learning, data visualization, and more.
Experienced Instructors: Our expert instructors have extensive experience in the field of data science and are committed to guiding participants through their learning journey.
Hands-on Projects: Participants will have the opportunity to work on real-world data projects, allowing them to gain practical experience and build an impressive portfolio.
Collaborative Learning Environment: Join a supportive community of like-minded individuals, fostering collaboration and networking opportunities.

For any inquiries or further information, please reach out to our team at arewadatascience@gmail.com.
Join us in shaping the future through data science! We look forward to receiving your applications and welcoming you to the Arewa DataScience Program.

title: Arewa Data Science Successful Applicants
text:
Fellowship Successful Applicants
We are thrilled to announce the selection of the first cohort of exceptional applicants for the Arewa Data Science Fellowship program. These individuals have shown exceptional aptitude and passion for data science, and we are confident that they will make significant contributions to the program and to the field of data science as a whole.
The selection process was highly competitive, and we received a large number of excellent applications. We would like to extend our congratulations to all of the successful applicants and we look forward to working with them in the upcoming program.
We are excited to see the impact that this program will have on the data science community and on the career development of these individuals. This fellowship program is a great step towards creating a more inclusive data science community in Nigeria.
The full list of the successful applicants is available here.
In addition to the exceptional training and mentorship they will receive through the Arewa Data Science Fellowship program, successful applicants will also receive a generous monthly stipend and free internet data to ensure they have access to the resources they need to be successful in the program.
Thank you to everyone who applied and we hope to see you again in the next cohort.
